:::{#hero-heading}

Hi there, I’m **Ziqian Xia**, a Ph.D. student in Environmental Behavioral Sciences at
[Stanford University](https://www.stanford.edu/) and visiting researcher at the
[Cambridge Collective Intelligence & Design Group (CamCID)](https://camcid.github.io/),
University of Cambridge.
I study the **human and policy dimensions of climate change**, combining large-scale surveys,
IoT and remote sensing for **actionable mitigation and adaptation**.

- Climate perceptions & individual carbon footprints in China (MRP/MIRO; **China Climate Communication Initiative**).
- Behavioral interventions and IoT-enabled measurement for mitigation/adaptation.
- Open and transparent science; cross-national datasets and policy relevance.

Prior to Stanford, I trained with [Chao Zhang’s Group](https://sem.tongji.edu.cn/semen/12413.html) at Tongji University, China, [Xi Tian’s Group](http://sem.ncu.edu.cn/szdw/gccrc/gccrcjxssqjhljrc/799a668ea7be430c9edb199b04109392.htm) at Nanchang University, China, and the [Bits to Energy Lab](https://www.digitaltransformation.rw.fau.eu/) at Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU), Germany.

:::

## News (latest)

<div id="news-latest" class="list-group mb-2"></div>
<p class="mb-4">
  <a href="news.html" class="btn btn-sm btn-outline-primary">All news</a>
</p>

<script>
  (function () {
    const NEWS_PATH = "files/data/news.json"; // relative to site root
    const MAX_ITEMS = 3;

    fetch(NEWS_PATH, {cache: "no-cache"})
      .then(r => r.json())
      .then(items => {
        const container = document.getElementById("news-latest");
        if (!Array.isArray(items) || !container) return;

        items.slice(0, MAX_ITEMS).forEach(i => {
          const a = document.createElement("a");
          a.className = "list-group-item list-group-item-action d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center";
          a.href = i.url || "news.html";
          a.innerHTML = `<span>${i.date} — ${i.text}</span>`;
          container.appendChild(a);
        });

        if (container.children.length === 0) {
          const li = document.createElement("div");
          li.className = "list-group-item";
          li.textContent = "No updates yet.";
          container.appendChild(li);
        }
      })
      .catch(err => {
        console.error("News load error:", err);
        const container = document.getElementById("news-latest");
        if (container) {
          const li = document.createElement("div");
          li.className = "list-group-item";
          li.textContent = "News temporarily unavailable.";
          container.appendChild(li);
        }
      });
  })();
</script>
